timeline.bodyText: Can you use parent selectors so you don't have to repeat #body-container all over the place? https://sass-lang.com/documentation/style-rules/parent-selector You are using Sass, you should take advantage of it

replies.bodyText: Since we need to override vendor CSS without using !important, I have taken one unique Id in the body, based on that Id have overridden CSS. Rather than using parent selector in each level, i have taken single unique parent selector from body.

replies.bodyText:
I apologize if I don't understand your exact question. The goal is to write the styles in a structured way without duplication using sass, but it shouldn't affect the CSS output at all. Excuse me if you are already clear on all this, but we are writing Sass (.scss files), not CSS. There are several syntax differences, but in the end it generates plain old CSS. To read more about Sass see https://sass-lang.com/documentation/syntax.
If it's issues with the output you could try running sass from the command line, see https://sass-lang.com/guide for how to invoke sass, and compare it to the original file here.
